title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Open Higher As RIL, HDFC Bank Lead Gains - NDTV Profit
IRFC shares surge over 3% as company emerges lowest bidder for ₹3,167 crore project in Jharkhand; all you need to know - Upstox
summary:
IRFC Shares Surge Over 3% as Company Wins ₹3,167 Crore Project Bid

Date: January 15, 2024 | Source: PTI

Shares of Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) rose by 3.65% after being announced as the lowest bidder for a significant financing project in Jharkhand.

IRFC is set to finance ₹3,167 crore for the development of the Banhardih Coal Block, managed by a joint venture with NTPC and Jharkhand Bijli Vitran Nigam Limited.

  • IRFC shares increased by 3.65% to ₹140.50 on the NSE.
  • The company has reported a nearly 5% share growth over the past year.
  • In Q2 FY25, IRFC's net profit rose to ₹1,613 crore, an increase of 4% year-on-year.
  • The board approved an interim dividend of ₹0.80/share for the fiscal year.
“IRFC will strengthen the financial ecosystem for railway infrastructure projects,” said IRFC Chairman Manoj Kumar Dubey.

The surge in IRFC shares reflects positive investor sentiment following this significant project tender win, contributing to both the company's growth and its role in supporting Indian Railways.
newTitle: IRFC Shares Surge Over 3% as Company Wins ₹3,167 Crore Project Bid

title: ‘Tu hai kaun s**la’: Woman abuses cab driver for being 7 minutes late, internet hails him for keeping his composure - Hindustan Times
Karnataka plans KWIN City as education hub for premium institutions, global universities - Moneycontrol
summary:
Karnataka plans KWIN City as education hub for premium institutions, global universities

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Karnataka is planning KWIN City, which will host leading global institutions and aims to set itself as an education hub. The state has offered land for the Tata IISc Medical School in this innovative city.

  • The KWIN City encompasses an area of 5,800 acres between Dabaspet and Doddaballapur.
  • It is divided into four districts: Knowledge, Health, Innovation, and Research.
  • The Tata Group has partnered with IISc to establish a medical school, committing Rs 500 crore.
  • The proposal aims to attract premium educational institutions and enhance educational infrastructure in Karnataka.
“We aim to create a modern educational ecosystem that will cater not just to local students but also to international learners,” said Karnataka's Minister MB Patil.

The initiative is expected to bolster Karnataka's reputation as a center for higher education and innovative research.
newTitle: Karnataka plans KWIN City as education hub for premium institutions, global universities

title: Meta to lay off 3,600 employees; have decided to raise the bar, says Mark Zuckerberg - The Times of India
summary:
Meta to lay off 3,600 employees; have decided to raise the bar, says Mark Zuckerberg

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Meta has announced a significant reduction in its workforce, laying off 3,600 employees as part of an effort to improve company efficiency and focus on key priorities.

  • The layoffs are part of a broader restructuring plan initiated by CEO Mark Zuckerberg.
  • Zuckerberg emphasized the need to raise operational standards within the company.
  • This move is seen as a response to economic pressures and the need for improved performance.
  • Meta aims to streamline its operations to better align with current market demands.
“We are raising the bar on our performance and efficiency.” – Mark Zuckerberg

The workforce reduction at Meta reflects ongoing challenges in the tech industry, where companies are adapting to a rapidly changing environment.
newTitle: Meta Plans to Lay Off 3,600 Employees Amidst Organizational Changes

title: BSE shares have another 24% upside, will overcome regulatory hurdles, Nuvama says - CNBCTV18
summary:
BSE Shares Projected to Grow 24% Amid Regulatory Changes, Says Nuvama

Publication Date: January 16, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) Ltd. are expected to grow further, with a predicted upside of 24%, according to Nuvama Institutional Equities.

  • BSE shares have increased nearly 145% in the past year.
  • Nuvama initiated coverage with a 'Buy' rating and a price target of ₹6,730.
  • Projected CAGR for revenue is 39.9% and for adjusted profit after tax (APAT) is 70.8% from FY 2024 to 2027.
  • BSE's 15% stake in CDSL is valued at ₹5,450 crore and significantly contributes to its price target.
  • Concerns include adverse regulatory changes and over-dependence on the equity index options segment.
  • Jefferies upgraded BSE shares to 'Hold' with a new price target of ₹5,250.
“We believe BSE is better equipped to face the impact of changes in market structure brought about by SEBI's November 2024 circular reforming the index derivatives market.”

BSE shares closed at ₹5,440, reflecting a 5.5% increase on Tuesday.
newTitle: BSE Shares Projected to Grow 24% Amid Regulatory Changes, Says Nuvama

ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors - News18
summary:
ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: News18

Shares of ITC Hotels have been credited to the Demat accounts of eligible ITC shareholders following the allotment.

  • Allotment was announced on January 11 and credited on January 13.
  • Shareholders received SMS notifications regarding the credit of shares.
  • The shares appear as a dummy ticker without value in shareholder accounts.
  • Share allotment ratio is 10:1; 125.11 crore shares allocated.
  • ITC Hotels is no longer a subsidiary of ITC Ltd as of January 11, 2025.
  • Listing on NSE and BSE expected within 60 days of NCLT approval.
“The Board of Directors of ITC Hotels Limited met on January 11, 2025...Consequently, ITC Hotels Limited has ceased to be a subsidiary of ITC Limited effective January 11, 2025.”

The transition marks a significant step for ITC Hotels, indicating its independence and upcoming market presence.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors

Adani Group Expands Wind Power Capacity in Gujarat

Publication Date: January 14, 2025

Source: DNA India

With the commissioning of a new plant, Adani Group's operational renewable generation capacity has now reached 11,666.1 MW, highlighting significant growth in their renewable energy sector.

  • Adani Renewable Energy Forty Eight Ltd has commissioned a 57.2 MW wind power component at Khavda, Gujarat.
  • This new capacity addition is part of the wind-solar hybrid project aimed at enhancing renewable energy output.
  • Agel's market capitalization stands at Rs 1.60 lakh crore as of the latest update.
  • Shares of various Adani Group companies saw substantial increases following this announcement.
“With this new plant, our total operational renewable generation capacity has significantly increased.” - Adani Green Energy Statement

This expansion reflects Adani Group's commitment to renewable energy and aims at furthering India’s transition towards sustainable power sources.

title: Warren Buffett names his successor: 5 things to know about Howard Buffett, the man set to helm Berkshire Hathaway - Hindustan Times
summary:
Warren Buffett has named his son, Howard “Howie” Buffett, as the non-executive chairman of Berkshire Hathaway; here's what you need to know about him

Date: Jan 14, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Warren Buffett has officially named his son Howard Buffett as his successor to helm Berkshire Hathaway, officially marking the culmination of a long-term succession plan.

  • Howard Buffett is the middle son of Warren Buffett and has been named non-executive chairman of Berkshire Hathaway.
  • Howard has an extensive career in agriculture, starting his own excavating business and managing a farm bought by Warren.
  • He has served in various civic roles and held positions on multiple corporate boards, including Berkshire Hathaway since 1993.
  • Howard's philanthropic work includes significant contributions to humanitarian efforts, particularly in Ukraine.
  • Warren Buffett expressed his confidence in Howie's preparation for the role derived from years of mentorship.
“I feel I’m prepared for it because he prepared me,” Howie said.

The appointment of Howard Buffett signifies continuity in Berkshire Hathaway’s leadership, emphasizing trust, integrity, and a long-term vision.
newTitle: Warren Buffett Names His Successor: 5 Key Facts About Howard Buffett

title: NARCL emerges as sole bidder for Jaiprakash Associates' ₹12,000 crore loan auction - CNBCTV18
summary:
NARCL emerges as sole bidder for Jaiprakash Associates' ₹12,000 crore loan auction

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: CNBC-TV18

The National Asset Reconstruction Company Ltd (NARCL) has emerged as the sole bidder for the ₹12,000 crore loan auction of Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAL), following a Swiss Challenge auction conducted by IDBI Capital.

  • NARCL's bid was the only one received, requiring a payment structure of 15% cash and 85% in security receipts.
  • Jaiprakash Associates has outstanding claims of ₹52,073.79 crore under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC).
  • The resolution process for JAL has been ongoing for over seven years.
  • Lenders are seeking to expedite asset recovery due to previous litigation-related delays.
No other bidders participated in the auction.

Given the lack of competing bids, lenders will review NARCL's offer and seek necessary approvals for the loan sale.
newTitle: NARCL Wins Bid for ₹12,000 Crore Jaiprakash Associates Loan

title: M Rajeshwar Rao to head MPC, T Rabi Sankar in-charge of financial market ops in RBI's portfolio rejig for... - Moneycontrol
summary:
M Rajeshwar Rao to head MPC, T Rabi Sankar in-charge of financial market ops in RBI's portfolio rejig for deputy guvs

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has announced a reshuffle of portfolios for its deputy governors, effective January 15.

  • M. Rajeshwar Rao has been appointed to head the monetary policy department.
  • T Rabi Sankar will oversee financial market operations.
  • Swaminathan Janakiraman will manage financial stability and financial inclusion departments.
  • This reshuffle comes following the end of Michael Debabrata Patra's tenure as the senior deputy governor in charge of monetary policy.
“The Central government has already initiated the process of finding Patra's successor,”

This strategic reshuffle aims to enhance the efficiency and focus of the RBI's leadership in addressing current economic challenges.
newTitle: RBI Deputy Governors Reshuffle: M Rajeshwar Rao to Head MPC

title: M Rajeshwar Rao to head MPC, T Rabi Sankar in-charge of financial market ops in RBI's portfolio rejig - Moneycontrol
JPMorgan’s Piepszak exits CEO race to become operations chief, incumbent COO Daniel Pinto to retire in 2026 - Mint
summary:
JPMorgan’s Piepszak Exits CEO Race to Become Operations Chief

Date: January 14, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

JPMorgan management is undergoing a significant change as Jennifer Piepszak steps down from CEO considerations to take up the role of chief operating officer. This decision comes as Daniel Pinto, the current COO, plans to retire by the end of 2026.

  • Jennifer Piepszak has been a top contender to succeed CEO Jamie Dimon.
  • Piepszak will take over as COO from Daniel Pinto on June 30, 2025.
  • Jamie Dimon, aged 68, may step down within the next two and a half years.
  • Piepszak prefers a senior operating role over seeking the top CEO position.
  • Doug Petno will succeed Piepszak as co-CEO of the commercial and investment banking division.
“Piepszak has made clear her preference for a senior operating role, working closely with Jamie and in support of the top leadership.” - Bank spokesperson

This leadership shuffle is part of JPMorgan's broader strategy to sustain a strong management pipeline while preparing for future transitions in leadership.
newTitle: JPMorgan’s Piepszak Exits CEO Race to Become Operations Chief

title: JPMorgan's Piepszak exits CEO race to become operations chief, incumbent COO Daniel Pinto to retire in 2026 | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
JPMorgan's Jennifer Piepszak Becomes New COO; Daniel Pinto to Retire in 2026

Publication Date: January 14, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Jennifer Piepszak has stepped out of the CEO race at JPMorgan to take on the role of chief operating officer, succeeding Daniel Pinto, who will retire in 2026.

  • Piepszak was considered a strong candidate to succeed Jamie Dimon as CEO.
  • She has held various significant roles at JPMorgan over her three-decade career.
  • Daniel Pinto will retire at the end of 2026 after serving as COO.
  • JPMorgan plans to separate the roles of CEO and chairman following Dimon's eventual departure.
  • Doug Petno will succeed Piepszak as co-CEO of the commercial and investment banking division.
“Piepszak has made clear her preference for a senior operating role, working closely with Jamie and in support of the top leadership.” - Bank Spokesperson

With Jennifer Piepszak becoming COO, JPMorgan aims to maintain a strong leadership pipeline and support effective management following notable leadership changes.
newTitle: JPMorgan's Jennifer Piepszak Becomes New COO; Daniel Pinto to Retire in 2026

title: SEBI proposes mandatory issuance of new securities in demat form post-stock split, mergers | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
SEBI Proposes Mandatory Demat Issuance for Securities Post Split and Mergers

Publication Date: January 15, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has proposed that listed companies must issue new securities in demat form after stock splits, consolidations, and mergers to enhance securities dematerialization and reduce risks associated with physical securities.

  • SEBI aims to encourage the holding of securities in demat form.
  • Companies must open demat accounts for investors who do not have them.
  • The proposal is open for public comments until February 4.
  • Benefits of dematerialization include reduced frauds, faster transfers, and lower costs.
“To achieve the objective as stated... It is proposed to amend SEBI (LODR) Regulations, 2015 to mandate the issuance of securities only in demat form...” - SEBI

This proposal is part of SEBI's ongoing efforts to ensure greater security and transparency in trading practices.
newTitle: SEBI Proposes Mandatory Demat Issuance for Securities Post Split and Mergers

title: IISc and Tata Group partner to establish medical school in Bengaluru - Deccan Herald
summary:
IISc and Tata Group Partner to Establish Medical School in Bengaluru

Published: 14 January 2025, 14:36 IST

The Tata Group will contribute Rs 500 crore to the establishment of a new medical school at IISc, aiming to create a center for clinical research and medical education in India.

  • The Tata IISc Medical School will focus on specialized fields such as oncology, cardiology, and public health.
  • It will offer integrated MD-PhD and dual degree programs to develop physician-scientists and medical technologists.
  • The school seeks to integrate clinical practice with scientific research.
“We are very grateful to the Tata Group for their generosity,” said Prof G Rangarajan, Director, IISc.

The collaboration aims to innovate affordable healthcare solutions for India and beyond.
newTitle: IISc and Tata Group Partner to Establish Medical School in Bengaluru

title: Rs 300 cr to Rs 4287 cr AUM in 1 year! Nithin Kamath says, 'good thing about being passive-only is...' - ET Now
summary:
Zerodha Fund House Achieves Impressive AUM Growth in One Year

Updated Jan 14, 2025 by ET Now

The Zerodha Fund House has experienced a remarkable growth in assets under management (AUM), soaring from Rs 231 crore to Rs 4287 crore in just one year since its launch. Nithin Kamath expresses optimism about the success of the passive-only investment approach.

  • The AUM increased approximately 18 times in one year.
  • Zerodha Fund House aims to provide simple, transparent, and affordable investment products.
  • Launched India's first Growth-NAV-based Liquid ETF, LIQUIDCASE, for short-term cash management.
  • As of January 8, 2025, the fund house has over 4 lakh unique investors across 15,000 pincodes.
  • The typical investor age ranges from 28 to 36 years, with a large representation from smaller towns.
  • Future focus will include enhancing passive investment options, improving investor relations, and educational outreach.
“The good thing about being passive-only is that it aligns the incentives for both the customers and us.” – Nithin Kamath

This growth signals a strong interest in passive investment strategies within the Indian market.
newTitle: Zerodha Fund House Achieves Impressive AUM Growth in One Year
